# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(current_line) + length(word) <= text_width
            # Append to current line
            current_line *= " " * word
        else
            # Wrap to new line
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        end
    end
    # Handle the last word or a trailing space
    if length(current_line) > 0
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello there this is a very long sentence that needs to be wrapped at 10 characters per line.")
"Hello there
this is a
very long
sentence that
needs to be
wrapped at 10
characters per
line."
```
